Quickstrike:




Quickstrike stared out, watching for Tarantulas' and Megatron's 
positions. He didn't like being left alone with those two, even if 
Tarantsulas was half trusting. He needed to get away. He needed time 
to figure out what was wrong with himself, and find out how to right 
it. Maybe he could force some repairs onto it.

He crawled out from his hidding spot, looked left and right, then 
skittered to the exit-way of the cave. He stopped and transformed to 
robot mode. 

Snow. That slagging awful stuff. He wasn't made to deal with it, but 
right now, he had no choice. He stepped out, and quickly shut the 
door behind him. He walked out into the cold, chilling his metal 
armor. Within a few steps, he looked down at the edge of the walkway, 
which looked oddly to him. It was the side of a mountain. Slag, where 
did they take him to?

Down below, there was something going on. Battle, that what it was. 
He couldn't go down there, even if most of his insticts would love to 
be in it. He was not fuctional enough to deal with it. He was 
deprived of energy and with dizzy spells. 

He walked off to the side, down to a rocky slide. He put one foot 
down, looking at the slope. He could get down there if he was 
careful. He leaned to the side, grabbed a hold of a rock at the side, 
and took a few steps down sideways. 

Within a few seconds, looking down, his vision started to spin. He 
held on tight to the side of the moutain. He closed his optics 
tightly. If something like this kept up, he would fall. He waited a 
few more moments until his dizziness lightened up. He then make the 
rest of his decent down to the foot of the mountain.
